headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Oklo, Vistra, Opendoor, Intel, GM, Revolution Medicines, Tilray, and More
summary: Stocks rose Friday after fresh jobs data showed U.S. unemployment ticked down in December and a potential Supreme Court ruling on tariffs failed to pan out.  Vistra  stock surged 11% and  Oklo  jumped 7.9% after the nuclear energy companies unveiled separate agreements to provide power to  Meta Platforms  in order to support the hyperscaler’s data-center campus in Ohio.  Meta inched up 1.1%.

headline: Stock Market Today: Dow, S&P 500 Close At New Highs; These Aerospace, Homebuilder Firms Shine (Live Coverage)
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and other major stock indexes ended Friday's session with beefy gains after a jobs report surprise.  Meanwhile, homebuilders such as D.R. Horton jumped on the stock market today as mortgage rates fell below 6% after President Donald Trump instructed Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to buy $200 billion in mortgage bonds.  The Dow ended the day gaining 0.5%, or 238 points, and closed at a fresh new high.

headline: Oklo, Vistra rise on Meta deal, Opendoor surges on Trump post
summary: US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) are rising on Friday after the December jobs report showed the US added fewer jobs than expected, giving investors hope that Fed will stand pat on rates at its January meeting.  Shares of Oklo (OKLO) and Vistra (VST) are rising after inking nuclear deals with Meta (META). Stocks like Opendoor (OPEN) and Rocket (RKT) are jumping after President Trump instructed his "representatives" to buy $200 billion in mortgage bonds. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Real Estate Stocks Jump on Trump’s Mortgage Bond Plan. Are 5.5% Rates on the Horizon?
summary: Shares in real estate tech platforms and home builders rallied on Friday after President Donald Trump outlined a plan to buy mortgage bonds in a bid to make homeownership more affordable.  Investors’ hopes for a rebound in the housing market just got a whole lot better.  Mortgage lender  Rocket Cos.  rose 6.7%, putting the large mortgage originator on track for its highest close since 2021, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Why Taylor Morrison Home (TMHC) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of homebuilder Taylor Morrison Home (NYSE:TMHC) jumped 4.4% in the morning session after Citizens initiated coverage on the company with a "Market Outperform" recommendation, while the broader homebuilding sector benefited from government action.

headline: Wall Street tracking toward tiny gains in premarket ahead of the latest US jobs report
summary: Markets on Wall Street were leaning toward tiny gains early Friday ahead of the Labor Department's release of the latest U.S. employment data.  Futures for the S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average were up around 0.1% before the bell, while Nasdaq futures ticked up 0.2%.  U.S. homebuilder stocks continued to rise, though more modestly than they did a day earlier when President Donald Trump said he was directing the federal government to buy $200 billion in mortgage bonds.
